item.title: Using DipTrace
item.description: Exporting Gerber and Drill Files from DipTrace # All of the following is done in the PCB Layout application within Diptrace. Exporting the Bottom Layer # Choose File | Export | Gerber Click “Bottom” from the list of Layers Verify that only Traces, Pads, and Vias are selected from the list of Objects Change units to “Metric” Verify that the X and Y offsets are both 0 Click “Export Layer” to save the Bottom layer as a Gerber (.

item.title: Using Autodesk Eagle
item.description: Exporting Gerber and Drill Files from Autodesk Eagle # Autodesk Eagle is now Autodesk Fusion 360. All of the following is done in the Electronics Design workspace of Fusion 360, with a PCB document open. Download the CAM Processor Job File # To make the export process simpler, I have created a CAM Processor job file. Download it here before continuing. Export the Gerber and Drill Files # Press the / key to activate the command line Type the command camprocessor Choose the document icon at the top of the CAM Processor window, select “Open CAM File…” Select the CAM Processor job file you downloaded earlier Click “Process Job” and choose a destination folder for your Gerber and drill files Bad Drill File
